result.execSummary:
All charges against Quinton S Peterson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Quinton S Peterson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Quinton S Peterson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Connor Romenesko appeared by video for Quinton S Peterson.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness was not present. Defense motions to dismiss as this is the second time that the State's Witness was unable to appear. Court grants the motion. On motion of the Defense Counsel, court orders case dismissed without prejudice.

Defendant Quinton S Peterson appeared by video, in custody in CDC.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court in person for Quinton S Peterson.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness unable to appear due to a medical appointment. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Oral No Contact Order with EDB
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Quinton S Peterson in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Quinton S Peterson in custody at Children's Detention Center.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Quinton S Peterson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
